pages.text: Echinochimaera is a Carboniferous holocephalian with fossils known from Beach Gulch Montana. Its name means prickly chimaera, referencing the spines that lined its body and tail. The genus shows a high amount of sexual dimorphism with males looking wildly different from females. The males were more spiny and larger than the female specimens.
